links: K. A. Penson, P. Blasiak, G. Duchamp, A. Horzela and A. I. Solomon, Hierarchical Dobinski-type relations via substitution and the moment problem [J. Phys. A 37 (2004), 3475-3487]

formula: Second LAH transform of A000012. LAH transform of A000262. a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n) 2^(n-k)*n!/k!*binomial(n-1, k-1). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Oct 17 2003Define f_1(x),f_2(x),... such that f_1(x)=e^x, f_{n+1}(x)=diff(x^2*f_n(x),x), for n=2,3,.... Then a(n)=e^{-1/2}*4*{n-1}*f_n(1/2). - _Milan Janjic_, May 30 2008From _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jun 22 2013: (Start)Recurrence: a(n) = (4*n-3)*a(n-1) - 4*(n-2)*(n-1)*a(n-2)a(n) ~ 2^(n-3/4)*n^(n-1/4)*exp(sqrt(2*n)-n-1/4) * (1-1/(3*sqrt(2*n)))(End)E.g.f.: E(0)/2, where E(k)= 1 + 1/(1 - x/(x + (k+1)*(1-2*x)/E(k+1) )); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Jul 09 2013a(n) = hypergeometric([-n,-n,-n+1],[-n],2). - _Peter Luschny_, Sep 22 2014
mathematica: Table[ n! 2^n LaguerreL[ n, 1, -1/2 ], {n, 0, 12} ]With[{nn=20},CoefficientList[Series[Exp[x/(1-2x)],{x,0,nn}],x] Range[0,nn]!] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Aug 12 2012 *)
prog: (Sage)A025168 = lambda n: hypergeometric([-n,-n,-n+1], [-n], 2)[Integer(A025168(n).n(100)) for n in range(20)] # _Peter Luschny_, Sep 22 2014
